back_flavor: When Marie discovered her Grand-Mère's dark and sordid legacy of blood magic, she did her best to ignore it. It was much easier to just sing in the smoky lounges and packed nightclubs of Arkham, and far less dangerous. But then times got tough. As crowds thinned and patrons grew surly, Marie found herself embracing her Grand-Mère's powers to sway her audience, quieting the rowdy ones and enticing the wealthier amongst them to open their wallets. Relying on her dangerous powers increasingly often, Marie felt they were becoming a necessary tool to get through the day. Surely there would be no cost for this newfound power... right?
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Grand-Mère's Charm, Called to Guinée, 1 random basic weakness.
flavor: "I've got one hell of a showstopper in store for you tonight."
name: Marie Lambeau
text:
[reaction] After damage is placed on Marie Lambeau: Draw 2 cards and discard 1 of them. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If you succeed, heal 1 damage.

name: Grand-Mère's Charm
text:
Marie Lambeau deck only.
[fast] Take 1 direct damage and exhaust Grand-Mère's Charm: Replenish 1 charge on an asset at your location.

name: Called to Guinée
text: Revelation - Put Called to Guinée into play in your threat area. You cannot heal damage. [action] Choose and discard 3 cards from your hand: Discard Called to Guinée.

name: Shadowmeld
text: Uses (4 charges). [action]: Evade ([willpower]). If you succeed, you may spend 1 charge to move to a connecting location. If you reveal a [tablet] token during this test, remove 1 charge from Shadowmeld (if you cannot, lose 1 action and discard this card).

name: Infuse Life
text: Heal 3 damage from among investigators and/or [[Ally]] assets at your location.

name: Spiritual Charm
text: Parley. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or at a connecting location. Move that enemy to your location, engage it, and gain resources equal to its combined damage/horror values.
